column1: Depalpur is a town and a Nagar panchayat in Indore district in the state of Madhya Pradesh
column2: India. Depalpur is around 41.7Km from Indore.
the town is named after the Paramara dynasty ruler Devapala (reigned 1216–40).
Depalpur is mentioned as one of the 10 mahals of the Ujjain sarkar in Malwa Subah. Later
column3: it became part of the Princely state of Indore. The Zagirdar of Depalpur was Rai bahadur Nanak Chand Airen (1840-1920). After his demise
column4: his descendants distributed the family property to the farmers of Depalpur and currently

column1: Depalpur is located at 22.85°N 75.55°E﻿ / 22.85; 75.55. It has an average elevation of 533 metres (1748 feet).

column3: 200. Males constitute 51% of the population while the females constitute the remaining 49%. Depalpur has an average literacy rate of 57%
